page.title: 11RELIGION
page.content: MOST OF THE RELIGIOUS BUILDINGS IN THE AREA BELONG TO THE CHRISTIAN CHURCHES.THEY REFLECT THE RELIGIOUS TRADITIONS OF THE POPULATION OF HARROW AT THE TIME OF DEVELOPMENT 50-100 YEARS AGO.THE POPULATION NOW HAS A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF ADHERENTS OF OTHER FAITHS ALTHOUGH CHRISTIANITY IS STILL THE MAJOR RELIGION. THE JEWISH COMMUNITY BUILT A SYNAGOGUE IN 1959. A GROUP OF SHIA MUSLIMS HAVE A CENTRE IN A REDUNDANT SCHOOL BUILDING AND A PRIVATE HOUSE CONTAINS A HINDU TEMPLE.THERE ARE ALSO STRONG JAIN AND ISMAELI COMMUNITIES. SOME MUSLIMS GO TO MOSQUES IN WEMBLEY OR REGENT'S PARK AND SOME HINDUS TO TEMPLES IN WATFORD OR NEASDEN.{HARROW {INTER_FAITH COUNCIL}WAS FORMED IN 1984 TO PROMOTE GREATER UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN PEOPLE OF DIFFERENT FAITHS.
